page.title: 01A GENERAL REVIEW.
page.content: The twelve square kilometres allocated to the pupils of Whitemoor C P School can be found in Mid-Cornwall,15km from the shores of the Atlantic Ocean to the Northwest and 6km from the English Channel to the Southeast. . The{granite-based}rock covers the highest ground in Mid-Cornwall, being only 100m below the level of Brown Willy.The{villages}of Roche and Whitemoor are the only major settlements in the area. The{China Clay Industry}dominates the land cover,with its overburden tips _white man-made hills,rapidly being transformed into grassy, lupin-covered slopes.{Farmland}is used for rough grazing or intensively managed grassland.{Amenities} are few, as are public transport facilities. There is a strong Methodist tradition in the area.
